titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Levi Arnold Post (1889-1971) was a Greek scholar and taught at Haverford College from 1919 to 1958. His wife was to Grace H. Lickely Post (1896-1999). He is the author of From Homer to Menander: Forces in Greek Poetic Fiction and The Vatican Plato and Its Relations. He was an Editor and Secretary-Treasurer of the American Philological Association, and later served as the Association's President. He was an editor of the Loeb Classics Library from 1940 to 1967.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the professional papers of L.A. Post. Materials include: offprints by Post and other scholars, many of them with presentation inscriptions to Post; journals and books; notes, typescripts, and galley proofs of articles; correspondence with fellow scholars, editors, and publishers; lecture notes; and photographs of a student production of a Greek drama.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
